reasoning: A comma before 'so' when it introduces an independent clause is a stylistic preference in formal writing to improve clarity.
A comma should precede 'and' when it connects two independent clauses to improve readability in formal writing.
A comma should precede 'and' when it connects two independent clauses to improve readability in formal writing.
The repetition 'so so' is informal and should be replaced with a more formal intensifier like 'very much' or simply 'so much' in a WJEC document.
